intro: Hesperis matronalis subsp. matronalis, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and are known for their sweet, spicy fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
